revised_title: Chemical Potential in Thermodynamic Systems under Non-Hydrostatic Stresses
tldr: This article introduces the concept of a chemical potential for each chemical component in thermodynamic systems under non-hydrostatic stresses. It proves that the chemical potential has the same value throughout a multi-phase system in equilibrium and demonstrates how it can be used to determine the conditions for equilibrium between and within phases. The findings have implications for understanding stress in solids at chemical equilibrium with fluids and can be applied to various fields, including geophysics and metallurgy.
